items: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
Extend your right arm straight up towards the ceiling.
Bend your right elbow and reach your right hand behind your head, placing your palm on the center of your back.
Use your left hand to gently pull your right elbow towards your left shoulder, feeling a stretch in your right lat muscle.
Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, then release and repeat on the other side.
Increases flexibility and range of motion in the latissimus dorsi muscle
Helps alleviate tension and tightness in the upper back and shoulders
Improves posture by stretching the muscles that contribute to rounded shoulders
May help reduce the risk of injury in the upper body during physical activity
Can be done anywhere without the need for equipment
Latissimus dorsi
Teres major
Rhomboids
Trapezius
Posterior deltoid
